intro: Microloma lineare, commonly known as the narrowleaf microloma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Microloma lineare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
